Article text: It has been noticed lately that some of our students and alumni are being targeted for bullying, trolling, harassment and even physical threat on social media and other platforms. This is deeply concerning and unbefitting for the students and alumni of an institution like UIU that enjoys a reputation of academic excellence and integrity at the national and global level. UIU stands firmly against such unlawful behaviour. UIU is inviting its students and alumni, who have been/are being subjected to such harassment on cyberspace and in other forms, to fill in the Google form—describing the harassment that you might have faced along with supporting evidence. UIU intends to take disciplinary measures against anyone found guilty. Please fill in the google form (Link: https://forms.gle/unPUVh3mLCxy8ab77 ) and send your inputs from your UIU email by September 18, 2024.

A committee has been formed, with the following composition, to investigate into the unfortunate incidents that took place at the UIU campus on September 04, 2024: Prof. Dr. Mohammad Omar Farooq, Head, Department of Economics: Convenor; Prof. Dr. Kaled Masukur Rahman, Professor – EEE, Department of Electrical & Electronic Engineering: Member; Dr. Suman Ahmmed, Associate Professor – CSE and Director – CDIP: Member; Ms. Nasrin Akter, Assistant Professor, School of Business and Economics; Member; and Mr. Muhammad Rehan Masoom, Assistant Professor, School of Business and Economics: Member-Secretary. Terms of Reference of the Committee: The Committee will thoroughly investigate the incidents of September 04, 2024 that took place on the UIU campus, including vandalism, violence, harassment, indecent behaviour, aggression, damage to the university properties, etc.; The Committee will identify the individuals involved in the above-mentioned incidents, which are violation of the disciplinary rules of UIU; The Committee will cross-examine the allegations of violation of the UIU disciplinary rules and establish the cases beyond doubt; The Committee will recommend necessary punitive measures to be taken against the individuals, who will be proven to be involved in the incidents; and The Committee may recommend any other measures that the university should adopt to prevent such untoward and unfortunate incidents in the future. The Committee is requested to submit its report by September 11, 2024.

ATTENTION: ALL CONCERNED STUDENTS Meritorious students with poor financial background coming from remote underdeveloped regions of Bangladesh are eligible to receive 100% Tuition Fee and Other Fees Waiver to support them throughout their educational endeavors at UIU. All concerned students, admitted in Fall 2024 Semester, intending to apply for 100% Tuition Fee and Other Fees Waiver for Meritorious and Poor Students from Underdeveloped Regions Quota are required to submit their application to the Office of the Controller of Examinations by September 11, 2024 (Wednesday). Application form is available in the UIU Website (Download). Please note that the following criteria will be followed in the sanctioning of 100% Tuition Fee and Other Fees Waiver under the Meritorious and Poor Students from Underdeveloped Regions Quota: 3% (three percent) of the newly admitted students of Fall 2024 semester, who qualify under this category, are eligible to apply in this category. The waiver is being offered for both undergraduate and graduate students. The applicant must have his/her permanent address in one of the upazilas listed under the category of ‘Very High Level of Poverty’ in the Bangladesh Bureau of Statistics (BBS) Report. The applicant must have passed HSC examination from an educational institution located in the upazila/district of his/her permanent address. A student, who receives this waiver, will be waived from tuition fee and other fees except admission fee, ID caution fee and retake course(s) fees. Upon selection, s/he will continue to receive the waiver till they obtain their degree, subject to the condition that s/he would be required to obtain a minimum GPA of 3.00 in a particular semester for becoming eligible to get 100% Tuition Fee and Other Fees Waiver in the following semester. Applicants, who are eligible for both the categories of 100% Tuition Fee and Other Fees Waiver for Meritorious and Poor Students from Underdeveloped Regions and 100% Scholarship in order of Merit, will be awarded the waiver from the category of 100% Tuition Fee and Other Fees Waiver for Meritorious and Poor Students from Underdeveloped Regions. Undergraduate students of BSc in Civil Engineering have to take 13.5 credits, B.Pharm have to take 14 credits, and BSSEDS/BSSMSJ/BA in English have to take 12 credits in each semester. Documents to be attached with the application (available online) seeking Tuition Fee and Other Fees Waiver for Meritorious and Poor Students of Underdeveloped Regions scheme are as follows: Recommendation letter(s) in favor of the student’s financial inability from the Union Parishad/ Municipality Chairman or the Ward Councilor. Notary Public certified 300 Taka Non-Judicial Stamp stating the student’s yearly family income and financial inability. Copies of NID card/Birth Certificate of parents and student. For queries, concerned students are advised to contact the Office of the Controller of Examinations [Room no. 103] in this regard.

To realize this mission and vision, the goals of UIU are as follows: To provide state-of-the-art and standard education as preparation for higher studies or future employment in positions of responsibility across a worldwide range of ICT, Business, Social, and Public Organizations. To offer internationally recognized education in Bangladesh and develop graduates up to international standards through accreditation from globally recognized bodies. To use modern instructional techniques and technology to enhance students’ educational and career goals, as well as the socio-economic development of the country. To establish joint degree programs with renowned universities in the USA, UK, Canada, and Australia, facilitating quality education and making foreign degrees available to students while staying in Bangladesh at an affordable cost. To provide educational opportunities to those already employed or engaged in business, allowing them to pursue undergraduate and graduate programs without interrupting their careers and without compromising quality education. To create a congenial academic environment free from political and other disturbances for intellectual advancement. To use information technology in all phases of academic and administrative aspects to ensure a free and transparent flow of information. To undertake additional programs and activities essential to achieving these objectives.

United International University is a private university approved by the Government of the People’s Republic of Bangladesh and the University Grants Commission (UGC). To fulfill its mission, UIU applies the following guiding principles: Study and students should be the first priority, with faculty, staff, and administration motivated to help students succeed academically and transition to productive members of society. UIU hires highly qualified and nationally and internationally reputed teachers to address a continuously changing environment. The university provides necessary infrastructural and logistic support and a conducive campus environment for teaching and learning. It seeks out new educational trends in developed countries, evaluates their adaptability in Bangladesh, and continuously updates the standard of education. UIU establishes joint degree and credit transfer programs with renowned universities abroad to facilitate quality education and offer foreign degrees to students while staying in their home country. The university supports research for advancing knowledge and socio-economic development through technology-oriented knowledge. UIU contributes to the moral and ethical development of students to foster a society free from corruption, promoting peace and harmony. It disseminates knowledge with an ethical, human, and rational approach, reflecting national heritage, values, and principles of Bangladesh. UIU creates educational opportunities for all groups, including rural, urban, and working individuals, through on-campus, online, and distance learning education.

21 Facts About UIU: UIU produces industry-ready, employable graduates, with all alumni well-placed both at home and abroad. It is consistently ranked among the top private universities according to QS Asia rankings from 2019 to 2023 and THE Impact Rankings from 2020 to 2023, including being in the Top 80 globally in SDG 1 in 2020 and Top 32 in SDG 8 in 2021. UIU, along with NSU and IUB, is one of the few business schools in Bangladesh with prospects for ACBSP accreditation. It boasts infrastructure comparable to most public universities and features the largest green campus within Dhaka city. The Center for International Assistance and Cooperation (CIAC) supports students with credit transfers, IELTS and GRE improvement, and international student exchange programs. Students receive professional training from industry experts through the Center for Development of IT Professionals (CDIP), VLSI Training Academy, Power Engineering Training Academy (PETA), Cisco Network Academy, and Center for Energy Research (CER). CER has consulted on about 90% of all solar energy projects in Bangladesh. The campus provides an international environment, special arrangements to enhance students’ communication skills, and conducts admissions and faculty recruitment with complete transparency. Faculty members enjoy intellectual independence, and UIU adheres to UGC rules and the Private University Act of 2010. The university is research-focused, investing significantly in research patronage, and employers and alumni are actively involved in curriculum design and development. Financial aid is provided to students every trimester/semester based on academic results. Bus services are available from major locations in Dhaka city, and MSc and MBA courses are offered on weekends for professionals and job holders. UIU has numerous clubs and forums for co-curricular and extracurricular activities, helping students develop soft skills and leadership qualities. The campus is a non-smoking area with immediate expulsion for drug possession, monitored by 24-hour CCTV surveillance, and prohibits extreme vulgar attire. Students are expected to be well-disciplined and mannered, ensuring a safe and secure environment for all.

If you are willing to do one semester at a foreign university that is not a partner university of United International University (UIU), you must pay the tuition fees to that university. If the curriculum and grading policy match the requirements of UIU, your completed credits for that semester will be accepted at UIU. Summer School or Summer University is a program generally sponsored by a foreign institution or private company that provides lessons and activities during the summer vacation. Students, both local and international, from United International University (UIU) are encouraged to go abroad to join summer school programs to benefit their educational progress.

Activities during the coursework include a pre-arrival online assignment (starter kit) and an 8-hour online course on business and entrepreneurship, which should be submitted one week before the course starts. The program features lectures by university professors, researchers, and successful entrepreneurs, project work (group work with instruction), customer interviews (visits to potential customers), site visits to companies and labs (guided by professionals), and socializing events (to expand your international network and learn about local culture). Additionally, there are pitches and business cases where each team will present their business case to a jury and investors, with a winner selected. A report is required for all EIT Digital participants and those seeking 4 ECTS from the course.

Required documents to complete the application for summer school include: i. Passport information page or scanned ID card; ii. Certificate of Enrollment (in English); iii. School transcript (in English); iv. The grading system includes the following letter grades and grade points: A (4.00) – Outstanding, A- (3.67) – Excellent, B+ (3.33) – Very Good, B (3.00) – Good, B- (2.67) – Above Average, C+ (2.33) – Average, C (2.00) – Below Average, C- (1.67) – Poor, D+ (1.33) – Very Poor, D (1.00) – Pass, and F (0.00) – Fail.

The Grade Point Average (GPA) is the weighted average grade for a trimester, while the Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) is the weighted average of the grade points obtained in all the courses completed by a student, including the last trimester.

A course in which a student has obtained a "D" or higher grade will be counted as earned credit hours. However, any course in which a student has received an "F" grade will not count towards earned credits, and the student will need to retake the course.

An Incomplete ("I") grade may be assigned in special circumstances at the discretion of the course teacher. The student must take the initiative to remove the "I" grade within 15 days of the following trimester. If no action is taken, the "I" grade will automatically revert to an "F".

Students may choose to retake a course if they believe grade improvement is possible. Those who wish to retake a course must register for it again and will be required to pay the applicable tuition and fees. The degree requirements for both undergraduate and graduate programs include maintaining a minimum CGPA of 2.00.

The increased frequency and intensity of extreme weather events, rising sea levels, temperature extremes, and altered precipitation patterns pose significant threats to the resilience and sustainability of infrastructure, leading to damage, service disruptions, and slowed economic growth.

The current infrastructure development scenario underscores the need for innovative solutions that prioritize both resilience and sustainability. At CSIRS, we are dedicated to pioneering research and technology-driven solutions aimed at strengthening our infrastructure systems.

Our interdisciplinary approach will bring together experts from diverse fields to address complex civil engineering challenges. From researching advanced materials and smart technologies to engaging with communities, CSIRS is committed to shaping a more resilient and sustainable future.

The Admission Test for the School of Business & Economics comprises a one-hour and twenty-minute exam featuring both essay and multiple-choice questions. It includes sections on English grammar and reading comprehension, SAT1/SSC syllabus-based mathematics covering quantitative, arithmetic, elementary algebra, and commonly known geometry concepts, as well as short essay writing.

BSS in Environment and Development Studies (EDS) program at UIU consists of four sections: General Knowledge (covering historically significant national and international events, and contemporary issues); English (including grammar, translations, synonyms and antonyms, and spelling correction); Contemporary Environment and Development Issues (such as environment, climate change, global warming, disaster management, and urbanization); and Essay Writing (in English).

The admission test for the BSS in Media Studies and Journalism (BSSMSJ) program at UIU is a one-hour test based on the SSC and HSC syllabus, consisting of four sections: (i) Multiple-choice questions in General Knowledge (covering Bangladesh and international affairs); (ii) Multiple-choice questions in English (focusing on grammar and language); (iii) Multiple-choice questions in Bengali (including grammar, language, and literature); and (iv) Short Essay/Paragraph writing.

The admission test for the Bachelor of Pharmacy (B. Pharm) program is approximately one hour long and consists of an essay or paragraph writing section and multiple-choice questions. The test covers English (focusing on grammar and reading comprehension) and HSC syllabus-based Biology and Chemistry.

The MBA admission test is one hour long and consists of three sections: (i) multiple-choice questions in English (focusing on grammar and reading comprehension), (ii) multiple-choice questions in Mathematics (including quantitative, arithmetic, elementary algebra, and commonly known concepts of geometry), and (iii) short essay writing.

The admission test for the BA in English program is approximately one hour and twenty minutes long, consisting of essay writing and multiple-choice questions based on the HSC syllabus, covering English grammar, reading comprehension, and vocabulary.

For online payments, students can use any branch of Southeast Bank, City Bank, or Dhaka Bank in Bangladesh, or visit the SIBL Vatara Branch, Natun Bazar, Badda, Dhaka.

Percentage of waiver: 100% for English Medium students. Criteria for Tuition Fee Waiver: Five (5) A’s in the O-level and 1 A and 1 B in A-level Exams. However, for students admitted in Engineering Programs, students must have a ‘B’ in either Physics or Mathematics in A-Level exams.

Percentage of waiver: 50% for students of English and Bangla Medium or equivalent public exams. Criteria for Tuition Fee Waiver: Five (5) A’s in the O-level and 2 B’s in A-level Exams, or HSC GPA 5.00 (without 4th subject) or equivalent public exams.

Percentage of waiver: 25% for students of English and Bangla Medium or equivalent public exams. Criteria for Tuition Fee Waiver: Four (4) A’s in the O-level, or HSC GPA 5.00 (with 4th subject) or equivalent public exams.

Admittees into any of the School of Science and Engineering (SoSE) programs, in addition to the policy mentioned above, must have passed Physics and Mathematics in the A-level program. For the continuation of the tuition fee waiver, undergraduate students are required to take 9 credits in each trimester (13.5 credits for BSc in Civil Engineering, 14 credits for B. Pharm, and 12 credits for BSSEDS/BSSMSJ/BA in English each Semester) and must maintain a CGPA of 3.5 to avail such tuition fee waiver. Additionally, for admission to BSEEE, CSE, and BSc in Civil Engineering programs, students must have Physics and Mathematics in their HSC/A-Level exams.

For graduate programs, a 25% tuition fee waiver is granted to students with a GPA of 3.50 on a 4.00 scale or 4.37 on a 5.00 scale in HSC or equivalent level public exams. To continue receiving the tuition fee waiver, graduate students must take 6 credits and maintain a CGPA of 3.5.

For undergraduate programs, the top 10% of students are eligible for scholarships ranging from 25% to 100%, provided they take at least 9 credit hours per trimester (13.5 credits for BSc in Civil Engineering, 14 credits for B. Pharm, and 12 credits for BSSEDS/BSSMSJ/BA in English under the semester system) and achieve a trimester or semester GPA of 3.50. In graduate programs, the top 10% of students can also receive scholarships ranging from 25% to 100% by taking at least 6 credit hours and maintaining a trimester GPA of 3.50.

A full tuition fee waiver (100%) scholarship will be awarded to students admitted to the B.Sc./M.Sc. in CSE program who have qualified for or participated in the following international competitions: International Olympiad in Informatics (IOI), International Mathematical Olympiad (IMO), and International Physics Olympiad (IPhO).

A partial tuition fee waiver of 75% will be offered to students admitted to the B.Sc./M.Sc. in CSE program who have secured a position in the Top 10 of the National Collegiate Programming Contest (NCPC) or who have qualified for the final rounds of the following competitions: Bangladesh Informatics Olympiad (BIO), Bangladesh Mathematical Olympiad (BdMO), and Bangladesh Physics Olympiad (BdPhO).

Students admitted to the B.Sc./M.Sc. in CSE program who secured a position in the Top 30 of the National Collegiate Programming Contest (NCPC) will be eligible for a partial tuition fee waiver of 50%. To continue with the scholarship, students must maintain a minimum CGPA of 3.0 and register for at least 9 credits per trimester for the Bachelor’s program or 6 credits per trimester for the Master’s program. Additionally, students must obtain a recommendation from the Head of the Department on a trimester basis

Dr. Md. Abul Kashem Mia is the Vice Chancellor of United International University. His office is located in Room 129. You can contact him via the university's PABX system or by email at kashem@uiu.ac.bd.

Dr. Md. Abul Kashem Mia holds a Ph.D. from Tohoku University, Japan (1998), an M.S. from Tohoku University, Japan (1995), an M.Sc. Engg. from the Department of Computer Science & Engineering, BUET, Dhaka, Bangladesh (1992), and a B.Sc. Engg. from the Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, BUET, Dhaka, Bangladesh (1989).

Dr. Md. Abul Kashem Mia has approximately 31 years of teaching and academic experience. He has been a Professor at the CSE Department of BUET, Dhaka, since July 1, 2018. Prior to that, he served as a Professor in the same department from March 1, 2012, to June 30, 2018, and was on deputation at the Institute of ICT, BUET, from October 17, 2006, to February 29, 2012. Before this, he held the role of Professor in the CSE Department from August 15, 2004, to October 16, 2006. Dr. Kashem was an Associate Professor at the CSE Department from October 30, 2001, to August 14, 2004, an Assistant Professor from April 2, 1998, to October 29, 2001, and started his academic career as a Lecturer in the CSE Department from December 9, 1989, to April 1, 1998 (during which he was on study leave from October 1, 1992, to March 28, 1998).

Dr. Md. Abul Kashem Mia also has additional part-time teaching experience. He served as a Professor at United International University from May 7, 2018, to May 6, 2019, while on leave from BUET. Currently, he is a part-time faculty member at the Military Institute of Science and Technology (MIST), a position he has held since July 1, 2015. Dr. Md. Abul Kashem Mia's research interests include Algorithm Theory, Graph Theory and Algorithms, Computational Complexity, and Bioinformatics.

Dr. Hasan Sarwar is a Professor in the Department of Computer Science & Engineering (CSE) and the Dean of the School of Science & Engineering (SoSE) at United International University. His office is located in Room 418 (A), and he can be reached via PABX at 3001 or through email at hsarwar@cse.uiu.ac.bd.

Dr. Hasan Sarwar holds a Ph.D. in Applied Physics, Electronics, and Communication Engineering from the University of Dhaka. He also completed his M.Phil. in the same field at the University of Dhaka. His undergraduate degree is a B.Sc. in Computer Science and Engineering from Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology (BUET). Prior to his university education, he obtained his Higher Secondary Certificate from Dhaka College and his Secondary School Certificate from Chittagong Collegiate School.

Dr. Hasan Sarwar’s research interests encompass a range of fields including Software Engineering, Health Engineering, Education Data Mining, Bangla OCR, Nanomaterial Development, and Blockchain. In Software Engineering, he is developing a methodology known as the 3D Model, which aims to streamline task phases, suit small teams, and facilitate quick delivery. His work in Health Engineering involves creating a smart monitoring system to assist ICU patients, thereby reducing ICU stay times and enhancing the treatment process. In Education Data Mining, he analyzes educational data to improve both student learning and teacher effectiveness. His research in Bangla OCR focuses on developing optical character recognition technology for the Bangla language. Additionally, he is involved in Nanomaterial Development, where he is working on low-cost methods for creating and characterizing nanomaterials using an arc discharge system. Currently, his attention is on Blockchain technology, with the goal of ensuring data security and privacy within the education sector.

Dr. Hasan Sarwar has a diverse range of professional and other experiences. He serves as the Director of Edusoft Consultants Ltd., focusing on developing and deploying a University Management System tailored for the higher education sector in Bangladesh. Additionally, he is a member of the Board of Accreditation for Engineering and Technical Education (BAETE) and has worked as a consultant for establishing a Distance Learning Resource Center for Bangladesh University of Health Science. Dr. Sarwar has received several research grants, including approximately $15,500 from the ICT Division, Ministry of Posts, Telecommunications, and IT, Government of Bangladesh, in June 2016, for developing a Mobile-Web based Electronic Health Records System for patient management in heart diseases. In March 2016, he secured around $10,700 from United International University for research on the Preparation and Characterization of Plasmonic Metal Nanoparticles deposited on glass. Another grant of approximately $30,000 was received in June 2015 from the Access to Information programme (A2i) of the Prime Minister's Office (PMO) for creating a Refreshable Digital Braille Display. He also obtained around $28,000 in October 2013 from the same programme for developing the first Bangla Optical Character Recognizer (OCR). Additionally, Dr. Sarwar was a consultant for Kent State University, supporting the establishment of the Bangladesh Research and Education Network (BDREN) from 2012 to 2016, a trust initiated under the University Grants Commission and supported by the World Bank.

Dr. Hasan Sarwar's publications include several notable works. In 2014, he co-authored a journal paper titled "Study of optical radiation efficiency of nanoparticles," published in *Nanoscience and Nanotechnology Letters*. The paper, which delves into the optical properties of nanoparticles, lists Hasan Sarwar, Tasnia Hossain, M. Junaebur Rashid, and Md. Mydul Islam as authors. In 2006, Dr. Sarwar published another significant paper on "Study of Transport Properties in 1D Nanostructured Semiconductor Devices using Monte Carlo Simulation" during the COIN-NGNCON 2006 - The Joint International Conference on Optical Internet and Next Generation Network, with Shahida Rafique as his co-author. Additionally, he presented a conference paper in 2020 on "Blockchain-based information security of electronic medical records (EMR) in a healthcare communication system," which was featured in *Lecture Notes in Networks and Systems*. The paper, focusing on blockchain technology for securing medical records, lists Rafita Haque, Md. Akhtaruzzaman, Muhammad Jafar Sadeq, S. Rayhan Kabir, Hasan Sarwar, Nafisa Haque, and Rokeya Forhat as contributors.

Dr. Mohammad Nurul Huda is a Professor in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering (CSE) and serves as the Head of the Department. His office is located in Room 412 A. For inquiries, he can be reached via PABX at 3101 or by email at mnh@cse.uiu.ac.bd.

Dr. Mohammad Nurul Huda has an extensive career in academia and administrative roles. He has served as a Professor in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering (CSE) at United International University (UIU) since December 17, 2013, and was a Visiting Professor in the Environment and Engineering Department at Northumbria University, UK, from November 15, 2013, to December 15, 2013. Prior to his current role, he was a Professor at UIU from June 13, 2013, to November 14, 2013, and an Associate Professor from April 16, 2009, to June 12, 2013. His experience includes roles as an Assistant Professor at Ahsanullah University of Science and Technology (AUST) from April 1, 2009, to April 15, 2009, and from October 2005 to March 2009 (on study leave), and as a Lecturer at AUST from September 1997 to September 2000. He was a Research Assistant at the GCOE, Frontiers of Intelligent Sensing, Toyohashi University of Technology, Japan, from September 2007 to March 2009. Dr. Huda has been a candidate for the Vice-Chancellor position at UIU in 2018 and Sonargaon University in 2019. His administrative roles include Director of the MSCSE Program at UIU from October 2018, MSCSE Coordinator from June 2009, and various committee memberships such as the Academic Council, Academic Admin Committee, Curriculum Review Committee, Admission Committee, and Credit Transfer Committee at UIU. He has also served as the Head of CSE at IBAIS University and as President of the Bangladesh Society at Toyohashi University of Technology, Japan. His research projects include Smart Irrigation System funded by the World Bank, the Anubad English to Bengali Machine Translation Project, Natural Language Processing (NLP) Project with eGeneration Ltd, and Smart Reception funded by the ICT Ministry of Bangladesh. Dr. Huda has contributed to accreditation processes as a visiting team member for IEB and as a peer review team member for IQAC at UIU. He has also been involved in recruitment and promotion committees at various institutions, including UIU, Stamford University, AUST, ULAB, and IBAIS University. He has served on question moderation and best teacher/student selection committees at MIST and has been a member of the Question Maker Committee for the Information Technology Engineers Examination organized by JICA. Additionally, he has part-time teaching experience at several institutions, including IICT-BUET, BIM, BOU, MIST, Asian University of Bangladesh, The University of Asia Pacific, Dhaka International University, Jagannath College, Vocational Education and Training Institute, The Peoples University of Bangladesh, and Infinity Institute of Technology.

Dr. Mohammad Nurul Huda has received several notable achievements, awards, and grants throughout his career. He was an invited speaker at the UNESCO conference on Language Technology for All (LT4all) in December 2019. He received JICA grants for training in the Information Technology Engineers Examination (ITEE) in Myanmar in November 2018 and in Japan in February 2016. Dr. Huda was awarded the MONBUKAGAKUSHO scholarship by the Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science, and Technology, Japan, from October 2005 to March 2009. He also received several international conference attendance grants: for China from the COE program “The 21st Century COE program Intelligent Human Sensing” by MEXT, Japan, in 2007; for Antwerp, Belgium, from Toyohashi University of Technology in 2007; for Brisbane, Australia, from the Global COE program “Frontiers of Intelligent Sensing,” MEXT, Japan, in 2008; and for Hawaii, USA, from the Global COE program “Frontiers of Intelligent Sensing,” MEXT, Japan, in 2009. His academic achievements include receiving Education Board Scholarships from October 1992 to May 1997 and from July 1988 to June 1990, as well as a Junior School Scholarship from January 1986 to December 1987.

Dr. Mohammad Nurul Huda's research field encompasses a wide range of topics, including Speech Recognition, Speech Synthesis, Speech Analysis, Machine Translation, and Phonetics. His work also spans Artificial Intelligence, Fuzzy-Based Systems, Machine Learning, Algorithms, and Pattern Classification.

Dr. Mohammad Nurul Huda has reviewed papers for several international conferences, including the International Conference on Communications and Electronics (ICCE 2010) in Vietnam and the 4th International Conference on Software, Knowledge, Information Management and Applications (SKIMA 2010).

Dr. Mohammad Nurul Huda has served as the chair for several prestigious international conferences, including the 14th International Conference on Computer and Information Technology (ICCIT 2011) and the 13th International Conference on Computer and Information Technology (ICCIT 2010), both held in Dhaka, Bangladesh. Dr. Khondaker Abdullah-Al-Mamun is a Professor in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering and the Director of IRIIC at United International University. His office is located in Room 1012B. For inquiries, he can be reached via PABX at 3115 or by email at mamun@cse.uiu.ac.bd.

Khondaker A. Mamun received his Ph.D. in Computer and Biomedical Engineering from the University of Southampton, UK. He subsequently worked as a Postdoctoral Research Fellow in the PRISM Lab with joint appointments at the Institute of Biomaterials and Biomedical Engineering (IBBME) at the University of Toronto and the Bloorview Research Institute at Holland Bloorview Kids Rehabilitation Hospital, both in Toronto, Canada. Since October 2014, he has served as an Associate Professor and then Professor at the Department of Computer Science & Engineering at United International University (UIU), Dhaka, Bangladesh. Prof. Mamun is the Founder and Director of the Advanced Intelligent Multidisciplinary Systems Lab (AIMS Lab) at UIU, where his team conducts research on 4IR technologies including artificial intelligence, big data, and the Internet of Things, focusing on applications in healthcare, disabilities, brain-computer interfaces (BCI), and education. He has published over 130 peer-reviewed international journal and conference articles, holds several patents, and has developed digital healthcare and rehabilitation models and mobile solutions for developing countries. His research and innovations have been featured in local and international media such as New Scientist and BBC. Prof. Mamun’s contributions to innovation and sustainable development have been recognized both internationally and by the government of Bangladesh. He leads more than ten national and international research projects in his lab. Additionally, he is the founder of CMED Health, a startup that originated from AIMS Lab's research, which provides digital healthcare solutions and aims to achieve universal health coverage (UHC) in Bangladesh, serving over 3 million people. CMED Health has won several awards, including the National ICT Award and the APICTA Award. Prof. Mamun also received these awards for his work on Autism Barta and Bolte Chai, smartphone apps for autism screening and communication enhancement for nonverbal children, respectively. He organized and chaired the first medical engineering conference in Bangladesh, MediTec 2016, and the first and second International Neuroscience Schools (IBRO APRC 2017 and 2019). He introduced the first Deep Brain Stimulation surgery for Parkinson’s patients in Bangladesh and contributes to the WHO/ITU Focus Group on AI for Health (FG-AI4H) and the Digital Health Strategy 2020-2025 for Bangladesh. He also serves as a national consultant for health information systems and data management for the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, Government of Bangladesh.

Dr. Khondaker Abdullah-Al-Mamun completed his Postdoctoral research in the Institute of Biomaterials and Biomedical Engineering (IBBME) and Holland Bloorview Kids Rehabilitation Hospital, University of Toronto, Canada, from 2012 to 2014. He earned his Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D.) in Computer Science and Biomedical Engineering from the University of Southampton, UK, in 2012, with a dissertation on "Pattern Identification of Movement Related States in Biosignals," supervised by Prof. Shouyan Wang and examined by Prof. John Stein and Dr. David Simpson. He holds a Master of Science (M.Sc. Engg.) in Computer Science and Engineering from Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology (BUET), Dhaka, Bangladesh, completed in 2007, with a dissertation on "Memory Efficient Data Structure for Static Huffman Tree," supervised by Prof. Dr. Md. Mostofa Akbar. He earned his Bachelor of Science (B.Sc. Engg.) in Computer Science and Engineering from Ahsanullah University of Science and Technology (AUST), Dhaka, Bangladesh, in 2002, ranking first in order of merit, with a dissertation on "Architecture of Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) for a Group of Companies," supervised by Dr. Tamjidul Hoque. He completed his Higher Secondary School Certificate Exam (HSC) in the Group of Sciences at Nanglakot H.M. Degree College, Comilla, Bangladesh, in 1997, and his Secondary School Certificate Exam (SSC) in the Group of Sciences at Nangalkot A.R. High School, Comilla, Bangladesh, in 1995.

Dr. Khondaker Abdullah-Al-Mamun has contributed as a reviewer for a variety of prominent journals and conferences. He has reviewed for the IEEE Robotics and Automation Magazine, Journal NeuroEngineering and Rehabilitations (BMC), Journal of Computers in Human Behavior (Elsevier), and the Public Journal of Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Medicine, and Biology. Additionally, he has served as a reviewer for the Research Ethics Board and Graduate Scholarship Program at Bloorview Research Institute, Holland Bloorview Kids Rehabilitation Hospital, University of Toronto. His conference reviewing includes the IEEE Asia-Pacific World Congress on Computer Science and Engineering 2014, IEEE International Conference on Electrical and Computer Engineering 2014, IEEE RAS/EMBS International Conference on Biomedical Robotics and Biomechatronics 2014, IEEE/RSJ International Conference on Intelligent Robots and Systems 2014, The 9th Annual International Joint Conferences on Computer, Information, Systems Sciences, & Engineering 2013, and several other international conferences and workshops.

Dr. Khondaker Abdullah-Al-Mamun has been serving as a Professor in the Department of Computer Science & Engineering (CSE) and as the Founder & Director of the Advanced Intelligent Multidisciplinary Systems Lab (AIMS Lab) at United International University (UIU), Dhaka, Bangladesh, since May 2018. Prior to this, he was an Associate Professor at UIU from October 2014 to April 2018, where he also founded and directed AIMS Lab. From May 2012 to July 2014, he was a Research Fellow at the Institute of Biomaterials and Biomedical Engineering (IBBME) and had a cross appointment at the Holland Bloorview Kids Rehabilitation Hospital in Toronto, Canada. He served as an Assistant Professor at Ahsanullah University of Science and Technology (AUST), Dhaka, Bangladesh, from June 2006 to October 2014. During his time at the University of Southampton, UK, he worked as a Part-time Lecturer / Demonstrator from October 2009 to July 2012 and was a PhD Research Student at the Institute of Sound and Vibration Research from October 2008 to July 2012. He also worked as a Researcher at King Saud University, Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, from November 2007 to July 2008. Earlier in his career, he was a Lecturer at AUST from April 2003 to June 2006 and held part-time roles at AUST and UIU as a Lecturer and CCNA Instructor.

Dr. Khondaker Abdullah-Al-Mamun's research interests encompass a range of cutting-edge topics including Intelligent Systems, Brain-Machine Interface (BMI), Signal and Image Processing, Pattern Recognition, and Machine Learning. He is deeply engaged in Neurocomputing and is interested in Access Communication and Assistive Technologies, as well as Human-Computer Interaction (HCI). His work also involves Feature Extraction and Classification of Biomedical Signals, Mobile Technology for Healthcare Applications, and Health Informatics. Additionally, he explores Education Quality Management, Distance Learning, and Technology-Enhanced Learning, alongside Mobile Applications for Diagnostics and Health Management.

Dr. Khondaker Abdullah-Al-Mamun has received numerous awards and grants throughout his career. Notable achievements include winning Autism and Other NDD related Awards 2022 for Autism Barta and Bolte Chai, and multiple accolades for Bolte Chai including the Merit Award at the BASIS National ICT Award 2020, an Honorable Mention at the Bangladesh Innovation Award 2021, and recognition at the APICTA Awards and the DBS-NUS Social Innovation Award in 2018. CMED Health has garnered several awards such as the Outstanding Contribution during COVID-19 at the e-COMMERCE MOVERS AWARD 2020, the Best Innovation at the Bangladesh Business Innovation Awards 2019, and the Innovation Prize by TAG Heuer at Seedstars Summit 2018. Dr. Mamun has also earned grants for attending international conferences and workshops, including full grants from EPSRC, MNN, and King Saud University, as well as scholarships like the Lord Rayleigh Scholarship and EPSRC Grant during his Ph.D. studies.

Dr. Khondaker Abdullah-Al-Mamun holds several prestigious memberships: he is a Fellow of the Bangladesh Computer Society and the Institute of Engineers Bangladesh (IEB), and a Member of the IEEE, IEEE Communications Society, and IEEE Engineering in Medicine and Biology Society. He is also a Life Member of the Bangladesh Bioethics Society.

Dr. Khondaker Abdullah-Al-Mamun has over 15 years of experience as an advisor, consultant, designer, and implementation lead for both government and non-government projects in ICT, Digital Health, Health Management Information Systems (HMIS), Education, and Disabilities, including Autism and Neurodevelopmental Disorders (NDD). He has consulted on Digital Health Strategy, last mile health services, and evaluation of e-MIS/e-health capacity, including aspects of interoperability, privacy, and security (GDPR/HIPAA). As a National Consultant for the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, Bangladesh, he reviewed and evaluated all Management Information Systems (MIS) of various departments. He is a contributor to the WHO/ITU Focus Group on AI for Health (FG-AI4H) and a member of the Technical Working Group for developing the Digital Health Strategy 2020-2025 for the MOHFW. Additionally, he holds a patent for a Digital Health Inclusion Model aimed at achieving Universal Health Coverage.

Dr. Khondaker Abdullah-Al-Mamun is the innovator behind several notable projects: CMED, a cloud-based medical system framework designed for rural health monitoring in developing countries; Bolte Chai, an augmentative and alternative communication tool (both device and app) for enhancing communication for nonverbal children; Bolte Chai Plus, an intelligent cloud-based communication tool to aid speech and language for verbally challenged children with Autism and Neurodevelopmental Disorders (NDD); Autism Barta, a mobile interactive, community-based automated tool for autism screening; PVDoctor, a cloud-based virtual doctor for Parkinson’s Disease screening and monitoring using AI; Virtual Eye Doc, a cloud-based smart application for eye care; and a Brain-Computer Interface (BCI) based neuromarketing system.

Dr. Khondaker Abdullah-Al-Mamun has also organized significant events, including the first Deep Brain Stimulation Surgery for Parkinson’s Disease in Bangladesh in 2017, the first and second IBRO APRC Neuroscience Workshops & Brain Symposia in Bangladesh in 2017 and 2019, and the first International Medical Engineering Conference (MediTec 2016) in Bangladesh.

Dr. Khondaker Abdullah-Al-Mamun has published over 100 articles in monographs, books, international journals, conferences, short papers, and abstracts. He has acted as a reviewer for international journals and conferences, served as a session chair, and participated in technical and organizing committees. His research has been featured in both local and international news outlets, including New Scientist and BBC. With over 15 years of experience, he has supervised graduate and undergraduate research, including 2 PhD, 20 Masters, 70 Undergraduate theses, and 30 internship/summer projects. He brings over 12 years of university teaching experience and has expertise in health and medical information system analysis, software design, development, and implementation. Additionally, Dr. Mamun has extensive experience in writing research grant applications, securing about TK 40 million in the past five years. He has delivered more than 100 keynote and invited presentations globally and has experience in translating scientific knowledge into commercialization. Notably, he achieved the Khanbahadur Ahsanullah Podak (Gold Medal) for securing the highest CGPA in his Bachelor Degree program in 2002.

Prof. Dr. A.K.M. Muzahidul Islam was born in Shariatpur district, Bangladesh. He earned his M.Sc. in Computer Science and Engineering with Honours from Kharkiv National University of Radio Electronics (NURE), Ukraine, in 1999, and his D.Eng. in Computer Science and Engineering from Nagoya Institute of Technology (NiTech), Japan, in 2007, supported by the Japanese Government Monbusho Scholarship (October 2002 – March 2006). With over six years of industrial experience in Bangladesh and Japan, Prof. Muzahid began his academic career in January 2011. He served as a Senior Lecturer at Malaysia-Japan International Institute of Technology (MJIIT) at Universiti Teknologi Malaysia (UTM) until January 2017, where he was also IT Manager and a member of the Management Committee for around five years. He then worked as an Associate Professor and Head of the Department of Computer Science and Engineering (CSE) at the University of Liberal Arts Bangladesh (ULAB) until September 2018. Currently, he is a Professor in the Department of CSE at United International University (UIU), Bangladesh, and serves as the Director of the Directorate of Career Counselling and Student Affairs (DCCSA). He previously served as the Director of the Center for International Affairs and Cooperation (CIAC). Prof. Muzahid’s research interests encompass Network Architecture, Communication Protocol, Cognitive Radio Network, Software Defined Radio, Wireless Sensor Network, IoT, Cloud Computing, Smart Healthcare, and Smart Agriculture. His teaching interests include Structured Programming Languages, Data Structures, Computer Networks, Data Communication, Wireless Communication, Cloud Computing, and IoT. He has published 110 research articles, including one book, two book chapters, 35 peer-reviewed journals, and 72 conference papers, and has secured over 10 national and international research grants. Prof. Muzahid has supervised eight PhD students (five as the main supervisor), seven master’s students, and many BEng final year projects. He is the initiator and General Chair of the International Conference on Bangabandhu and Digital Bangladesh (ICBBDB 2021) and the WICBBDB 2023 & WICBBDB 2024 Workshops. Additionally, he has served as the Technical Program Chair for ICAICT 2016 and ICAICT 2020, and as TPC Chair for ETCCE 2020 and ETCCE 2021, and as Secretariat for ICaTAS 2016 and 7TH AUN/SEED-Net 2014. He was an Advisory Member of ICBAPS2015 and Communication Track Chair at ICIEV15, ICAEE 2015, ICAEE 2017, and ICAEE 2019. Dr. Muzahid has also served as an Associate Editor for the International Journal of Computer and Information Technology (IJCIT).

Prof. Dr. Md. Motaharul Islam has been serving as the Director of the Masters in Computer Science and Engineering (MSCSE) Program at United International University (UIU) since January 2020, where he also holds a position as a Full Professor in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering within the Faculty of Science and Engineering. Prior to his tenure at UIU, he was an Associate Professor at Brac University (BracU) in the same department. He also worked as an Assistant Professor at the Islamic University of Madinah (IUM) in Saudi Arabia and at the Islamic University of Technology (IUT), Gazipur, Bangladesh. Dr. Islam earned his PhD in Computer Engineering from Kyung Hee University, South Korea, in 2013, specializing in Smart Internet of Things (IoT). He has previously served as the Chief Technical Officer of BERNET (now BdREN) under the University Grants Commission of Bangladesh (UGC). In terms of community service, he is the Director (Communications) for the Bangladesh Local Chapter of the International Network for Outcome-Based Education (IN4OBE), founded by Prof. Dr. William Spady, and is an editorial board member and reviewer for various international journals. With approximately 100 published research articles, his interests span Smart IoT, NB-IoT, IP-WSN, Cloud Computing, Network Virtualization, Edge Intelligence, and Machine Learning. Over the past seven years, Dr. Islam has been actively involved in outcome-based education (OBE) for ABET and BAETE, leading OBE and Curriculum Committees at UIU and BracU, overseeing the Cloud Computing Research Lab at BracU, and advising IEEE CS student chapters across different universities.

Prof. Dr. Md. Motaharul Islam completed his MS-PhD in Computer Engineering at Kyung Hee University, Seoul, South Korea, in 2013. He earned his B.Sc. in Computer Science and Information Technology from the Islamic University of Technology (IUT), Organization of Islamic Cooperation (OIC), Gazipur, Bangladesh, in 2002. He obtained his Higher Secondary Certificate (HSC) from Rajshahi College, Rajshahi, Bangladesh, in 1996, and his Secondary School Certificate (SSC) from Pabna Zilla School, Pabna, Bangladesh, in 1994.

He worked as an Assistant Professor in the Department of Computer Science (CS) at the Faculty of Computer and Information Systems (FCIS), Islamic University of Madinah, AlMadinah, Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, from December 2016 to August 2018. Earlier, he was an Assistant Professor in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering (CSE) at the Islamic University of Technology (IUT), Organization of Islamic Cooperation (OIC), Gazipur, Bangladesh, from December 2013 to December 2016. His academic career began as a Research Assistant in the Intelligent Cloud and Security Laboratory (ICNS Lab) at Kyung Hee University, Seoul, South Korea, from September 2009 to August 2013. He also held positions as a Senior Lecturer at the Institute of Scientific Instrumentation (ISI) under the University Grants Commission of Bangladesh (UGC) in Dhaka, Bangladesh, from January 2006 to August 2009, and at the Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Faculty of Science and Engineering, Green University of Bangladesh, Dhaka, Bangladesh, from February 2005 to December 2005. He started his teaching career as a Lecturer in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering at Uttara University, Dhaka, Bangladesh, from September 2003 to January 2005.

Prof. Dr. Md. Motaharul Islam was awarded the Brain Korea-21 (BK-21) Scholarship program, sponsored by the Government of the Republic of Korea, for IT international students during his MS-PhD program from September 2009 to August 2013. He also received the President Scholarship to support his tuition fees at Kyung Hee University, South Korea, during the same period. In 2012, he was honored with the Best Researcher Award from the Intelligent Cloud and Network Security (ICNS) Lab at Kyung Hee University. For his undergraduate studies at the Islamic University of Technology (IUT), Bangladesh, he was granted the Organization of Islamic Cooperation (OIC) Scholarship from 1999 to 2002. Additionally, he received the Bangladesh Government Scholarship for undergraduate studies from 1997 to 2000, the Bangladesh Government Scholarship for his Secondary School Certificate in 1995-1996, and a Junior Scholarship from the Government of Bangladesh for the period 1993-1994.

Prof. Dr. Md. Motaharul Islam's research interests include Smart Internet of Things (IoT), IP-based Wireless Sensor Networks (IP-WSN), and the design of routing protocols in IP-WSN. He is also focused on virtualization within IP-WSN/IoT environments, Cloud Computing, Edge Computing, and the Future Internet.

Mr. Nahid Hossain is an Assistant Professor in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering and the Undergraduate Program Coordinator, located in Room 433 (F). He can be reached via PABX at 3117 or by email at nahid@cse.uiu.ac.bd. For more information, visit his website at www.nahid.org.

Mr. Nahid Hossain has been serving as an Assistant Professor and Program Coordinator in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering at United International University, Dhaka, Bangladesh, since March 6, 2021, and February 23, 2024, respectively. Prior to this role, he was a Lecturer in the same department from April 26, 2018, to March 5, 2021. He also worked as a Software Engineer in the Department of Natural Language Processing at eGeneration Ltd., Ghulshan-1, Dhaka, Bangladesh, from July 26, 2017, to April 25, 2018.
Mr. Nahid Hossain's research interests include Natural Language Processing and Machine Learning.

Mr. Nahid Hossain holds an MSc in Computer Science and Engineering, graduating Summa Cum Laude. He also completed a BSc in Computer Science through an exchange program funded by the European Union and earned a BSc in Computer Science and Engineering, where he was a Gold Medalist and graduated Summa Cum Laude. Additionally, he has a Diploma in Engineering in Computer Science and Technology.

Mr. Nahid Hossain has taught the following bachelor courses: Software Engineering and Lab, Compiler Design and Lab, Algorithms, Object-Oriented Programming and Lab, Life Skills for Success, Structured Programming Language and Lab, Theory of Computation, and Web Programming.
Mr. Nahid Hossain has taught the following master’s course: Object-Oriented Programming.
